decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Bounding Krasis combo to create infinite tapped creature tokens for a quick win. The deck includes counterspells and removal to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Card draw and card selection spells help find the combo pieces quickly. Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and value. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. This deck aims to win through a powerful two-card combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while using card advantage and efficient removal spells to maintain board control. This deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope. By utilizing card draw and disruption spells like Remand and Cryptic Command, combined with threats like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Creeping Tar Pit, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until they can secure victory.

This deck is focused on putting pressure on the opponent with a variety of powerful Human creatures while disrupting their game plan with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to quickly deploy creatures and maximize mana efficiency. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage also help slow down the opponent, giving the aggressive creatures more time to close out the game. The mana base is built to support the Human tribal theme, ensuring that the deck can consistently cast its powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using rituals and cantrips, while also reducing the cost of spells with Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance. The main win condition is to cast Gifts Ungiven to search for combo pieces, then untap with Past in Flames to recast rituals and Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to storm off and win in one explosive turn, utilizing card draw and selection to find the necessary pieces to combo off efficiently.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to combo off using Proteus Staff and Polymorph to cheat Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield. It includes a mix of creature tokens, planeswalkers, and land creatures to provide alternate win conditions and support for the combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and synergies while utilizing card draw and removal to control the game state.

The deck focuses on assembling the Krark-Clan Ironworks (KCI) combo, which uses artifacts like Terrarion, Mox Opal, and Scrap Trawler to generate mana and card advantage. The goal is to loop through artifacts, sacrificing and recurring them to eventually cast Emrakul, the Aeons Torn for a game-winning play. The deck utilizes card selection with Ancient Stirrings and Glint-Nest Crane to find key pieces, while also running utility lands like Inventors' Fair and Academy Ruins for added consistency. The deck is built around fast mana generation and efficient card recursion to execute the combo effectively.

This deck revolves around assembling a combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing you to play out your combo pieces such as Walking Ballista to deal lethal damage to your opponent. The toolbox nature of the deck is supported by cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures like Kitchen Finks for life gain, Eternal Witness for recursion, and Selfless Spirit for protection. The deck aims to be flexible and proactive, utilizing a variety of creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan while advancing your own.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by using cards like Blood Moon, Stone Rain, and Molten Rain, while accelerating your own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. This allows you to play powerful threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Inferno Titan early in the game. The deck also includes a mix of card advantage (Tireless Tracker), ramp (Mwonvuli Acid-Moss), and removal (Primal Command) to control the game and outvalue your opponent in the long run.

The key concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent's resources by taxing their actions and disrupting their strategy. It utilizes aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Blade Splicer, supported by disruptive creatures such as Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck also includes cards like Flickerwisp and Restoration Angel to provide additional value and disruption. It aims to control the game through land denial with Ghost Quarter and disruptive spells like Path to Exile, while also providing a strong and fast clock with Pia Nalaar, Pia and Kiran Nalaar, and their token generation.

The focus of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Scavenging Ooze. It aims to ramp up mana with Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to play powerful threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Tireless Tracker. Collected Company provides card advantage and allows for explosive turns, while cards like Voice of Resurgence and Vendilion Clique help to protect the board and disrupt the opponent. The deck aims to be proactive, aggressive, and versatile in its strategy.

This deck focuses on maintaining board control and disrupting opponents through disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter. Aether Vial helps in quickly deploying creatures, while cards like Spell Queller and Mausoleum Wanderer provide additional disruption. The deck gains card advantage with Curious Obsession and protection with Selfless Spirit and Drogskol Captain. Ghost Quarter helps in disrupting opponents' mana base while Sea Gate Wreckage and Moorland Haunt provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while slowing down opponents' game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively using cards like Death's Shadow, Tarmogoyf, and Street Wraith to quickly reduce your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat. The deck also includes disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The deck can quickly close out games with cards like Temur Battle Rage and Ghor-Clan Rampager, making it a strong and fast-paced Aggro deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Voice of Resurgence, Knight of the Reliquary, and Courser of Kruphix, while utilizing cards like Collected Company and Noble Hierarch for additional value and mana ramp. It also includes cards like Path to Exile and Aven Mindcensor for disruption. With cards like Ramunap Excavator and Gavony Township providing additional synergy and utility, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy in the Modern format.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively play and utilize Death's Shadow as a powerful threat that can quickly grow in size by lowering your own life total. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize. The deck also includes card draw and deck thinning with Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to ensure consistent access to Death's Shadow and other key cards. Additionally, the deck includes strong creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to provide additional pressure and value.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful board presence of Elves and then use various cards like Collected Company and Lead the Stampede to generate card advantage and find key combo pieces. The deck aims to ramp up mana with cards like Heritage Druid and Elvish Archdruid to play powerful finishers like Shaman of the Pack and Ezuri, Renegade Leader. The inclusion of Bloodbraid Elf adds additional value by cascading into more Elves and providing additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Elves and finish them off quickly.

The main concept of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing fast land fetches and a diverse mana base, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Wild Nacatl, Tarmogoyf, Mantis Rider, Loam Lion, and Kird Ape. Providing a barrage of damage with cards like Lightning Helix, Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Tribal Flames, this deck aims to push through damage early and often, applying pressure and forcing the opponent to react defensively in order to secure victory.
